content.question: A compound made up of only carbon and hydrogen is completely combusted in excess <math alttext="O 2, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math>. Equimolar quantities of <math alttext="C O 2, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>CO</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> and <math alttext="H 2 O, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> are produced. Which of the following could be the molecular formula of the compound?

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
